medium: Animal hide, sinew, glass beads, pigment
title: Moccasins
text: The Inuna-ina (Arapaho), like the Tsistsistas (Cheyenne), were divided into two groups and put on separate reservations by the federal government around 1870.  Despite these difficulties, the Inuna-ina continued to produce fine beadwork; and they continue that tradition today.
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
